channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [OPENJPA-1849] testExternalValues failed with ORA-01438 Oracle exception
item.description:

... 21 more

item.summary: testExternalValues failed with ORA-01438 Oracle exception

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
What happens is the entity declares the following fields:

/*

  • By default, OpenJPA stores Chars as Ints, so to force the use of
  • a char(1) field, you would need to override this processing via
  • a DBDictionary property:
  • -Dopenjpa.jdbc.DBDictionary=derby(StoreCharsAsNumbers=false)
    */
    @Column(name="USE_STREAMING", length=1)
    @ExternalValues( {"true=T", "false=F"}

    )
    @Type(char.class)
    private boolean _useStreaming = false;

In Oracle, int is mapped to NUMBER(1) type

CREATE TABLE ExternalizationEntityA (id NUMBER NOT NULL, USE_STREAMING NUMBER(1), s1 VARCHAR2(3), s2 NUMBER, PRIMARY KEY (id))

However the character value of T/F are 0x54/0x46 which will take at least 2 digits, hence the exception.
